item.description:
As Solopreneurs, we frequently neglect the “tools of the trade” in running our companies. It has been proven that there is definitely a dramatic difference in income and profitability when individuals pay attention to the details, build a solid foundation for their business and run their business as a business. Today, the challenges are even greater as we shift into a virtual world that changes the way we communicate, market and sell. Those of us who do not adapt and leverage the "new economy" will definitely see their business shrink further as they will be overlooked and replaced by those solo's who face and embrace change. This shift also presents tremendous opportunities for growth and profitability for solos who take advantage of those "shifting winds of change". Q&A will follow the discussion.

Deborah J. Polydys, the owner and founder of Strategic Management Resources LLC (SMR), a business advisory firm specializing in working with entrepreneurs & solopreneurs since 1985, will lead the discussion. Visit her website at http://deborahpolydys...

Reserve your place and pay using the Paypal link, payments to Kolkdesign@usa.net at $24 per person. Please put ICC Meeting in the "Subject" box, and in the "Message" box, add your meal choice: Chicken Piccatta, Herb-Crusted Basa Sole, Pasta Primavera.

Reservation Deadline is Wednesday, June 2 by end of day. To cancel, you must do so by this time or your payment will be forfeited.

Our mission is to share ideas in a relaxed casual forum. Network and make new friends, treat yourself to a nice meal and enjoy the presentation. We hope to see you there.

group.name: Independent Creative Club of Greater Hartford

item.name: ICC Meeting: 10 Things that Make or Break the Solopreneur in Today's World
